answers.answer: I've never heard of anxiety causing tingling in one part of the body before. But, anxiety does come with a very long list of possible symptoms.The tingling in your hands and elbows might be carpal tunnel syndrome. Have you been checked for that?Another thing I would recommend is having your vitamin levels checked. Especially your B vitamins.

i ve checked carpali tunnel syndrome.its not.i have done all nerve tests.i m taking b comple supplement because i have hashimoto and i had a total thyroidectomy.doctors cannot find something wrong .i was afraid of M.S and now my fear is lupus but except of tingling/numbness i dont have any other lupus symptom.i m having those feeling in both arms and both legs

Do you see your Endo Dr on a regular basis to have testing done?Your symptoms could be caused from anxiety but if I were you I would still keep looking for answers by seeing your Dr and getting even more blood tests to rule any other causes out.Do you feel anxious and or have panic attacks?

i m seeing my Endo every 3 months.i ve done every blood test .i asked him if i have to go to a reumatologist and he told me no.after my thyroidectomy i m having panic attacks and i m always feel anxious.i never calm down because i don t know what wrong with me

You said you had all nerves tested, they tested the ulnar nerve? What you are describing sounds just like what I had a few years ago and still get every once in a while.  I had to keep my elbow from bending all the way. I don't remember how long it took me but a while.

yes they tested the ulnar nerve.i had elecromyograthy in all my hands and all my legs.everything was not just normal but in the perfect range.everything started 15 days after thyroidectomy.my hand was tingling and i googled hand tingling and ...M.S. neyrologists are sure its not M.S .they didn t want me to have mri but i did.its clear.i dont know what else i have to check.maybe i have to deal that is because of thyroid and aniety as my endo told me.but...i don t know

check your blood sugar for borderline diabetes. Diabetes can cause 'pins and needles'. I had it for years without knowing why till diagnosed with borderline diabetes after had a muffin before a routine blood test. Never was on medication, just diet and exercise. It's fine now.

If your anxiety started after the surgery that's what I would be leaning towards. Your med doses could be to high or to low. Many Endo Drs like to keep people at certain levels but it may not be the right level for them because we're all so different. Have you and your Dr tried adjusting your doses to see if that helps?

i have already check my blood sugar.i ve checked everything.my endo tries to find the perfect dose for me.last week i had my hormones tested and endo told me that my ft3 is in normal range but its low for someone without thyroid so we ve changed the dose again.15 days after thyroidectomy i woke up and my left arm was tingling .i was hypothyroid that time.my tsh was 24(o.3-5) i gooogled numbness and tingling and ....MS.so i m sure i have M.S.i ve read that hypothyroidism can cause nerve symptoms but mine were all the time.then started my other arm and then my legs.(its been a year )now everything its better but still not normal.yesterday while i was walking i felt an electric sensetion in my right side .is that lhermitte ?

question: can anxiety cause tingling(like pins)in the same point all the time?i have this tingling in both hands from my elbow to wrist for a year.also i have some weird feeling in my legs like bugs like pins.i have muscle pains,floaters in my eyes,etc i ve been to 11 neurologists i had all nerve tests and brain and spinal mri nad everything came back normal.they told me it s anxiety but i don t know if anxiety can cause a non stop tingling in same point body.is it possible.my fear is M.S but doctors told me no way.i don t know that to do.
title: permanent tingling
